setting.name: USFM Use Hyphenation
setting.description: Set to true to use hyphenation in the project. Hyphenation is important to any project but it needs to be setup before it can be used. Therefore the default is false Default = False

setting.name: ParaTExt Hyphenation File Name
setting.description: The name of the ParaTExt source hyphenation file.

setting.name: Hyphenation Errors File Name
setting.description: The name of the file Rapuma generates which contains words that were rejected by the hyphenation process.

setting.name: Hyphenation Prefix/Suffix File Name
setting.description: The name of the file that contains prefixes and/or suffixes for project words. This file is optional and if any prefixes or suffixes are found Rapuma will attempt to insert hyphens between any found and the root word.

setting.name: Hyphenation Word Processing RegEx
setting.description: Some times it is necessary to split root word syllables for hyphenation. This regex is contined in a list of two elements. The list should include both the search and replace sides. These will be inserted into the operating code to do the transformation. This is optional and if left blank, no processing will be attempted.
